author: Zanda
title: Lack of information
body:
I was recently transported to Lincoln Hospital by Ambulance for what was a suspected heart attack. All was reasonable right up to moving from assessment bay A&E to cubicle in main area of A & E.  
I was taken for an X Ray on wheel chair, but at no time was I asked to sanitise. Luckily for me there was a sink and soap dispenser in the cubicle I was in. A Dr came in and informed me bloods and X Ray were clear. I asked then why did I have this searing pain in the middle of my chest nearly identical to when I suffered a heart attack previously. They informed me the Nurse would come and talk to me with the paperwork. This didn‚Äôt happen, I was given tea and toast whilst change of shift happened and then waited until a person entered my cubicle and asked if I was waiting for a lift to which I replied I was waiting to get some information about my diagnosis, get the needle out of my arm and pads from the ECG connections to which they replied that they could take the needle out (still didn‚Äôt know who they were) which they did whilst telling me I could have gone home an hour ago, and that a letter would be sent to my GP.  
I phoned for my lift and was shown how to exit the dept and where the toilet was as I left. On entering the toilet, I saw blood on the door and general uncleanliness. Not a satisfactory episode in all fairness as I went home concerned what had happened. I shall be contacting my GP for answers which should have been given on the day.

author: cherry86
title: swallowing difficulties
body:
For over a year now i have had issues with swallowing food. It gets stuck on the way down and i have chest pains assossiated with this. I was referred for multiple tests a handfull were carried out before covid hit. I was due to attend for swallow studies and pH studies to assess my swallowing reflex. I understand that there are still issues surrounding covid but i have not heard anything about a new appointment when i call i get a message saying the department is temporarily closed and to contact the referring consultant. First off 6 months is not temporary and second my consultant can not do anything with out these test results as it is my treatment is at a stand still.  
I fully appreciate we are coming out of a pandemic but surely hospital services should be back up and running especially diagnostic tests.  
Is there a time line for getting the rest of the services up and running because at this rate its noe 8 months iv been waiting i know if it wasn't for covid i would have been seen within a few weeks.  
Can someone explain when all diagnostic tests are being carried out? Whats the hold up? Is there another option i can use is there somewhere else doing the tests i can attend?  
Thank you for reading my concerns and i await your response  
Kindest regards

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Dementia 85
title: Independent living with dementia serviced by the trust owned by housing provider
body:
My mum is 85 and has lived independently with dementia at Hemsworth Court for nearly 5 years. As a family we were delighted with the new facility in our area which would cater for mums needs on a 24hr basis but still allow family to play an active toll in mums every day life .  
Unfortunately Covid 19 had other ideas, around mid March the facility went into voluntary lockdown which we fully supported the manager called by telephone explained it was to insure the safety of all residents. By the end of March government lockdown officially began and mum received a letter stated it would start at the end of July. This date was eagerly awaited on by myself and family And of course mum who with the help of the wonderful staff had been well looked after and more importantly kept virus free . This is where things got complicated, according to manager the facility is still under trust lockdown as higher authority hasn‚Äôt been given, measures that he can put in place haven‚Äôt been agreed and his hands are tied ! So affectively my 85 year old mum has been under lock down for 6 months with no sign of let up , we are fortunate mums apartment is on ground level we have patio access now , but 6 months family haven‚Äôt been able to clean floors , toilets, change beds , wash floors dust !! I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre getting the picture, Independent living only works with families who can provide the care , staff are not domestic workers . I want decisions made ASAP my mothers physical and mental health are at a low , we are losing our precious time with her not to dementia but to a system that hasn‚Äôt developed the criteria to implement policies and agendas for a facility that‚Äôs not a care home !  
Feeling frustrated as my mum just wants out for a breath of fresh air ...

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Respect people with end of life diagnose
title: Care in the acute assessment ward
body: A family member of mine was admitted to the acute assessment ward suffering from cancer and end of life ..the treatment they have received from most of the nurses is dreadful..left with soiled bedding for over 24hrs..left in a room in my opinion with very little care and dignity other than a male nurse who does show some empathy..I intend to write to my local MP and complain regarding the lack of care my family member as received whilst in there care.

readBy.name: Bradford District Care NHS Foundation Trust
Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Mri
body: Went today the staff was so helpful and was a totally different experience from my last one would recommend to everyone that can to get there mri there was very nerves they calm me down and made me feel very safe the machine is a lot more roomy then the last one I had thank u all xx

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent facility
body:
What a fantastic experience in the department yesterday, environment and staff. I am disabled and their care for me was overwhelming, although not always needed. The attention I received was second to none; it was the same for everyone attending the clinic. You must be extremely proud of the service you provide, very efficient but not rushed in a calm atmosphere. 
I will receive recall in 2 months but what I received yesterday has a marked improvement to my problem.
Thank you so very much.

title: Excellent Service
body: I just want to put on record my appreciation for the service that I‚Äôve been receiving from the staff at the surgery. My wife and I joined up nearly three years ago, when our existing GP suddenly redrew their Practice boundaries and told us to find a new provider. We chose Sternhall Lane and since then we‚Äôve been consistently pleased with the service we‚Äôve received from the GPs and particularly impressed by the help and assistance that we‚Äôve had from the Practice Team.  Our previous experience had been  that of dealing with people who seemed remote and unapproachable. However, even in these difficult times, we now find ourselves dealing with bright welcoming reception staff, backed up by a practice secretary/managers who, in our experience, are able and to take decisions and to quickly resolve problems and difficulties.  Thank you!

author: GM10
title: My fathers stay in Ward 29 & return home
body:
My father (83yrs old) had a fall at home and an ambulance was called and took him to hospital for a scan to ensure all was ok. He went in for a 3 night stay in August. As far as we know he underwent scans and X-ray and no problems were found.  
My father predominately suffers from Parkinson‚Äôs. I am writing as the care and attention he received whilst in hospital was absolutely appalling. He was left in his bed for the majority of his stay. He would try and ask the nurses for several things but would always get ‚Äòjust a minute‚Äô response and no one would come back. We were not allowed to speak to him despite ringing several times a day. He was given food not appropriate as he has swallowing difficulty (eg sandwiches) yet on the discharge note they have advised in great detail how his food should be prepared etc. He was only given water to drink.  
Prior to his hospital visit he was able to walk aided by a stick however after no exercise and not eating due to the food provided he was so weak after he returned that he could not even walk. Many a time my mother asked why it took four days to do tests but no one could give an answer. Then finally on the day of his return he left the ward at 715pm but arrived at home at 10pm. It‚Äôs only a 20min drive. There were two other patients in the ambulance however these were both walking unaided and were middle aged. These two people were dropped of first but why so long a journey, where were they being dropped of??? Why leave an elderly man to last?? He actually said I‚Äôm getting hot here and was met with Oh you‚Äôll be ok by the driver. These two other patients were quite happy chatting and laughing with the driver and other ambulance man.  
I‚Äôm just so disappointed that the care was so poor and my father is actually worse now after his visit to hospital. If in the unfortunate case that we have to call an ambulance again can we opt not to go Heartlands Hospital??

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Day patient,first class professorial approach on‚Ä¶
body:
I have been well looked after by the staff and Surgeon whist I had my short stay at the Manor.
All necessary steps for Covid 19 were in place and very confident that any one staying at the Manor for long or short term appointments will be satisfied.

title: Great help
body: The Private Medical Report Administrator was incredibly helpful and quick with her responses. She was very kind and made the process of obtaining my letter really easy

title: Awful
body: Awful iv rang my doctor's lots during covid each time iv had to travel miles to see a doctor as my surgery isn't open I don't drive so this has cost a small fortune . We're now not in full lockdown and there still not seeing people in clinic schools are safe to go back pubs are open soft plays are open so why isn't my local doctors open why should I be paying ¬£20 each time me or my child need to see a doctor

title: Concerned medical professional who is a patient
body:
One of the partners of this practice shows poor professional duty of care.  They are supposed to be open till 8pm and are not. 
They do not care to follow through on patients despite the fact I can never get through. When o do persevere and wait for a telephone call back they  are too preoccupied with leaving early and not fulfilling there obligations. 
They are aware of the loop holes and play to them. 

I was due to get a call at 6pm -8pm 
I had one call at 5.52pm and one literally 4 minutes after I had spent 30 minutes on hold waiting to get through to the doctor. 

The answer phone message left was poor and yet again they had ‚Äú contacted twice ‚Äú despite being outside my allotted time. 

Poor practice. Poor care. 
Please be careful. Second time I am using a private GP to access NHS Care.

title: excellent experience
body: Didn't have to wait. Highly experienced and friendly professional who conducted the mammogram - put me at ease and was adept at enabling you to position yourself so that there was little discomfort

title: Caring response
body:
I was in so much dispair and the advice given was so beneficial.
I made the necessary adjustments and started to feel better. 
My follow-up review was great
I was also given follow up resources which were invaluable. 
Super grateful.

title: Simply outstanding.
body:
My first time for what was a planned big operation.
No visitors or family due to cv19
Ward 84 what a team. 
My 5 days in HDU I was treated with love and respect. The nursing team were outstanding . The support staff were the same.
I will never be able to thank you enough. 
Please pass on to all the team my heartfelt thanks.

title: Staff attitude
body: Diagnosed with lung cancer I had  pet scan to determine extent. I also have emphysema, facial nerve damage and eczema. All of which cause problems and entitle me to exemption from wearing face covering. So I was distressed by two members of staff pressuring me to wear one, with little empathy shown to a patient already at a low ebb.

title: Fast and efficient blood tests
body:
Fantastic service , in and out in ten minutes 
Couldn‚Äôt believe it 
Nurse was nice , friendly , and made me feel relaxed 
Thx k you v v much

title: Opening times are wrong
body: The practice is closed everyday between 1 and 2pm. I'm sure that's lovely for the staff but not great for patients. I think that's unusual for most practices these days.

title: Excellent GP Surgery, efficient service
body: I have recently switched surgeries and the difference in the service between the two is like day and night. I have been consistently impressed by the service and support from Bridge Cottage. They have quick response times and are very reliable. I wish I had registered with them years ago.

title: Brilliant service
body: I am on holiday in Durham and completed a 111 Online referral as I was feeling terrible with a throat on fire and temperature. A very nice chap rang me back with 10 minutes and within 45 minutes I‚Äôd been to Durham hospital and picked up medicine that had been prepared for me as I made my way there at 7.30 in the morning. Thank you for your professionalism and care üëçüëçüëç

author: inspirenq73
title: Small Growth on my Shin
body: After an appointment with my local GP the surgery contacted Torbay Hospital with the GP‚Äôs assessment. The following day I received a phone call from Torbay inviting me to attend a clinical assessment at the John Parkes Centre in Torquay. I arrived at the Centre on time and was immediately seen by a Dermatology Specialist.. The examination was thorough and the Specialist advised me that removal of the growth would be arranged a.s.a.p. The Specialist and the assistant Nurse were both kind, courteous and certainly put me at ease. Three days later I was invited to attend the John Parker Centre for treatment where the growth was surgically removed. Once again the Specialists who performed the local anaesthetic and the removal of the growth were kind and caring and I left the Centre feeling extremely relieved that the treatment had been completed successfully and with minimum pain. I would like to offer my sincere thanks to the John Parkes Dermatology team for the kindness and professionalising I received throughout my two visits to the Centre.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: super treatment
body: from arrival to departure I was looked after, everything explained and all questions answered.  Everyone was friendly and attentive and my needs were always addressed.

title: Caring Nurse
body: i'd been putting off my smear test for a long time however due to the education, coaching and comfort the nurse was able to provide, i finally did my test. Thank you

title: visiting facilities
body: Due to my own surgery and isolation periods, I have now very recently managed to see my wife who is in D3 QA hospital, I applied for a further visit but was told that the number of visitors was at a maximum of 10 visitors for one day for the ward, now I know that there is more than 10 patients in D3 so that implies that many patients do not receive any visitors at all if the visitors do not book early enough. I ask has anybody taken into account the mental stress that this can cause on top of their medical condition, there surely must be a more acceptable method to ensure safety for all. I would also say I was surprised at the number of staff primarily in reception areas who are NOT behind screens in the wards, who are not wearing a mask.

title: Best surgery out there
body: Doctors are well trained and professional. They always get the problem sorted. Reception staff are competent and refer you where needed accurately.

title: Awful
body: Have had to chase for a month on a weekly basis to get any information. Receptionist have been really helpful chasing the Dr involved too but the Dr has not once communicated with me. I‚Äôm now awaiting a letter from the Dr, no idea how long that will take.

title: This hospital must rank as the best
body: on sunday, l was in excrutating pain with Sciatica, the worst l have ever had, a call to 111 got me an appointment,half an hour later l arrived at the hospital, a quick and thorough check against corvid19, seen within 5 minutes by a Doctor, , treatment and  a prescription all done within 20 minutes,This Hospital and its Nursing staff put the Big Hospitals to shame, They care  and love the work they are doing, 10/10   Thank you  mike Mollart

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Very good service , same day phone calls from doctors, choice of doctor , recommendation ,kind staff, always get reminders for appointment,  telephone consultations , whole family is with this surgery,

title: Poor customer service
body: This is the worst surgery in the area. They never give any appointments and I have had so many issues which have never been resolved. I have had to wait up to 30 mins for the reception staff to tell me that they have no emergency appointments.

title: Mismanagement
body:
This centre is for vulnerable mentally ill patients in crisis
Unfortunately the staff from top to bottom seem to forget this, with the exception of the canteen, maintenance staff who are lovely.
The management ignores serious concerns to the detriment of patients 
The practice is to ignore emails, put the phone down on concerned family members, who are advocating for their mentally ill relatives Who are then subject to abuse, which is not addressed, and continues unabated
This mismanagement is the norm to such an extent that :
Staff inform relations ‚Äúwe can not talk to you ‚Äú and put the phone down 
Emails not ignored state‚Äù you have not been specific, further emails will be ignored; however  the abuse has been detailed !
Ward rounds are rushed with minimal family input as family  not informed until last min if at all
Psychiatrists do not do a evaluation of patients, and ignore family input, patients seeking advice are ignored, or left to their own devices.
Discharge is mismanaged with patients suffering as a result
Given the reviews on here, and on Google, the CCG should be arranging a QC inspection, which is long overdue.
I am aware of 2 recent complaints not been published, so I will be leaving my details for follow up, and forwarding to CCG and QC

title: Lost heart scan results (twice)
body: No words to describe. Having been told my results were not back yet I rang the hospital myself to see what the delay was.  A very helpful member of staff looked up the results and said they had passed them on to HBT surgery on 3/8/2020. They then rang the surgery whilst I was on hold and again passed on the results again. I was told to ring the surgery as they now had my results. When I rang, Again they could not find them. This is bad enough, as it takes up to 1 hour to get through. Unacceptable, poor service. Someone needs to take control of the front of house staff.

title: Disgraceful lack of compassion
body:
Husband admitted  with suspected  heart attack. He has late stage terminal lung cancer. I was not allowed to visit for 2 days due to being in EAU. And was told they would not give any details of what was happening  over the phone, even to our Macmillan  nurse who is based at the hospital. I informed  them he could not eat solid foods and for 2 days he was only offered normal food, until the last hour on that ward someone 
offered  him a fortisip drink.i was told by a member of staff on the ward, husband could walk out of ward and see me if he wished.. he did wish that but due to the lung cancer struggles to walk 20 foot. Now he is on a ward I am only allowed 1 short visit.  He is dying  and we have so little  time left.  Extra Compassionate visits should be allowed.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Problems with waiting time in bowel cancer‚Ä¶
body: Both times recently I  had a appointment, to see a oncologist have I had to wait 1hr 45 mins even though there were few people waiting, before I had my consultation even though my appointment stipulated that that I must arrive  not latter nor, sooner than a certain time. I assume this was so that I would not spend too much time in the hospital due to the Coronavirus crisis. I am very careful regarding social distancing and sanitizing ect. So you can image this long wait  was extremely stressful. When we did eventually see him the consultation was excellent .

title: Super helpful staff and Doctors
body: We've really struggled this year with elder members of the family ill from various illnesses, including trips to hosps and medication changes. The surgery staff and Dr's have really understood our difficulty and accommodated as much as possible. I cannot thank them enough. From simple medicine requirements to various referrals, they have consistently been on the ball. Thank you so much.

title: Fabulous service
body:
Attended minor surgery. Lovely staff. Fabulous care. Only took five minutes
Even coffee and a biscuit üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ

title: Efficient, professional and caring service.
body: I was admitted to a&e at 0730hrs on 24 Aug initial covid clearance very efficient nurse. Wheelchair provided with porter for access to main reception, again efficient and friendly. Collected by majors nurse. Impression, of the area,clean,tidy,an area of calm. Taken to individual room. During my stay I was handled in an efficient and friendly manner. The clam atmosphere allayed any concerns I may have had. I was dealt with in polite respectful way and informed of all actions concerning my treatment and care. I would highly recommend all the staff who looked after me. Please pass on my thanks to those medical and excellent nursing staff and aides I met. God bless our nhs, they deserve a big thank from the nation and a significant pay incentive. Peter hopkins former army officer.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: responsive, caring, well led- and overall good‚Ä¶
body: Admitted via ED on Saturday 22nd August to wd 22. Caring and compassionate staff and was seen by Consultant both on Sunday and Monday. Well run and good  service which is reassuring in these difficult covid times. Would recommend the L&D to family and friends.

title: Getting ridiculous with passing times
body: Every now and then they like to change their policies and expect others to adhere to it. Few doctors are really nice which is the reason I am still with this surgery but otherwise few people incl doctors and reception staff are extremely rude. They have different rules for different people. You have urgent/non-urgent/schedule appointment, call at 8 am and if you are lucky they will pick your phone and book you an appointment for that day. Otherwise expect nothing of excellence. I have had blood test and got message to book non-urgent appointment with the doctor but I can't do that because the surgery wont book schedule appointment. But while giving the blood test, nurse booked an advance appointment for me...So you wonder reception staff lying or have their own working policy ? You will never know i guess

title: Professional and caring staff
body:
On the 20th August I attended the Cardiology department to undergo a Angiogram. The welcome I had that day was very good and I was introduced to the staff involved in the procedure. I was fully informed about the procedure by a nurse who put me at ease. The doctor then spoke to me and explained again the procedure in more detail. I found this again was very helpful and as I was escorted into the theatre the rest of the team introduced themselves.
Getting prepared the nurse again explained what she was doing and stated that at any stage I could ask for a relaxant if I was in any discomfort. The doctor and nurses began the procedure and continued to inform me how it was progressing.
I was asked several times if I found the procedure uncomfortable or painful however I did not experience any discomfort.
Once it was over the staff were still talking to me and ensuring I was not in pain and if I had any questions about the operation.
Transferred into the recovery ward where the professionalism and kindness was still there. 
I am sure the CEO of the hospital is fully aware of the way their staff deal with the public however I would like my thanks to be sent to the staff involved. Despite the current pressures on the NHS  during this pandemic their professionalism, kindness and dedication to help shines through.
We have this great institution, the NHS, which has the most professional people working within that institution which we must support.
Thank you to all.
Les Jackson

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jen666xxx
title: My babies reflux nightmare
body:
I just wanted to come on here and say after seeing so many doctors and being told various things I came to Aberdeen children‚Äôs a and e and was met by a Dr Sarah. If it wasn‚Äôt for covid I would have hugged her. She left me in tears but tears of happiness. My baby is 3 weeks old and has been showing signs of severe silent reflux.  
My other child had this so I knew the signs after 3 trips to Gp and 2 trips to A and E where one doc told me I was over feeding my baby which turns out not to be true so when I reduced him like this doctor told me to I caused my baby more upset. I was ready to give up.  
My baby screamed for over 6 hours only stopping to feed I called the hospital again and Dr Sarah told me to come up. It took a while to see her as she was very busy as she was the on call paediatrician.  
She came and looked at my baby listened to me and agreed with me she also said she would be happy to start my baby on medicine! She then asked me how I was to which I broke as I was exhausted. She admitted us there for me to have some rest and my son to have his first dose of medication.  
I thank you so so much. I also would like to thank the staff on the ward that night especially Lorna who fed my son and let me rest I am truly grateful.

title: Lies, apologies and excuses
body: Lack of communication. Lack of supervision of patients. Lies about patient situation. Apologies for everything but no corrective action. Lack of therapy sessions  more like a holding pen until medication takes effect, if it does, than a treatment unit. Staff saying doctor's requests regarding treatment unreasonable. Then there's the lack of protection re Covid......

title: Poor experience rudeness of lady on reception
body: I attended today for a blood test and was a little apprehensive about going anyway due to covid. The sign says ring for appointment queries but as I had an appt I just walked in to be reprimanded by the lady behind reception. The way she spoke to me actually made be a bit tearful as I would not have gone in if the sign had been clear. Even so patients should not be spoken to so abruptly as we are not the enemy but just trying to access a service. Why be so rude? I am meticulous about social distancing and will follow any instructions that are clear.  I arrived wearing a mask and with hand sanitizer but the signage should simply say wait here if you have an appointment. The NHS is a government service and it is really sad that patients are spoken to badly as soon as they have entered the practice. A shame as the doctors are always so lovely here.  I really did feel I needed to write this review as it would actually put you off going to the doctors. Basic manners and politeness cost nothing.

title: Awful service
body:
Since 3 surgeries merged together the service is awful. It wasn't good before but this has deteriorated. Very slim chance of ever seeing a doctor. If you are lucky, you might get a doctor phone appointment 5 days later... or beyond.
Difficult to get help. Sad state of affairs

author: Japanese wife
title: Thanks to Ward 8 Staff Nurse
body:
We would like to extend our heartfelt thanks to all staff but in particular to Donna who cared for our father in his final days. It was apparent within moments of meeting Donna that she has a true vocation for nursing and patient care.  
She was exceptionally caring and sensitive towards my mother and spent, although very busy, time with my mum on several occasions offering comfort and patience. My dad was able to pass very peacefully and we are thankful to all the staff who allowed our family to be present with him during these trying times in the NHS.Thank you also to the consultant and Eleanor.With sincere thanks and gratitude

title: Friendly and prompt
body: Always friendly and never had to wait for very long to be seen or for my appointment. Super quick to make an appointment too by calling up

author: Thanks to Royal Cornwall
title: Everyone was compassionate, patient and caring.
body:
I was on holiday in Mevagissey Cornwall. I woke up with terrible pain in my right leg and a temperature of 41C. My husband called an ambulance as I was delirious. From the moment the ambulance arrived, the care I received was amazing. Everyone, from the doctors to the cleaners were compassionate, incredibly patient and caring. I have had many hospital admissions over the past 20 years as I have Lupus, and this admission was a true example of the NHS at its best.  
Thank you to everyone, particularly the staff on GLU ward.

author: Japanese wife
title: Offered words of comfort
body:
Thank you to the staff in MHDU who offered great comfort and care to my dad over the past several years. He always felt very safe and well cared for in this unit. Staff were gentle, patient, kind and excelled at their job.  
They never failed to offer words of comfort to my dad and also extend great patience in accommodating our large family at visiting times.  
Thank you

title: Great practice
body: Everybody is so helpful and friendly. I received care and support. All staff help me with my medical situations very effectively. I really like and recommend this practice to everyone...

title: Receptionist is very bad
body: Receptionist over the phone is very rude not helpful at all. Very poor Customer service. Even when I get number 1 on phone it took lot of time to answer. And receptionist is not ready to listen my problem at all.

title: Great Practice
body: This was a phone call due to the current situation.  I was able to discuss the two issues I have and was given great guidance and information for both, a very thorough call where I did not feel rushed. Although it was a phone call I felt that my issues were dealt with thoroughly.

title: Felt let down
body: After being taken into A&E via ambulance, it was found that i had a severe kidney infection, i was moved on to gate 38, for investigation, then put on to 36 room 8 for more investigations, after 1 night there and antibiotics starting to work, it was decided to put me on to gate 12 room 8, i was left almost 2 hours without water or pain relief that i requested as soon as i arrived there. I was woken up numerous times during the night for observations (which i understand they have to do) but also at 12:30am by a doctor asking me questions that would be in my notes. Then at 1100am a doctor came to see me and said that they would remove the IV antibiotics and give me it in tablet form, and i would be able to go home that afternoon. I then waited all day untill 4:00pm for my medication, to be able to go home. When it didnt arrive i asked where it was, to be told its been ordered its at the pharmacy, which on a Sunday closes at 5:00pm, it wiuld be here by then. Happy with the explanation i waited. No tablets came. I have a history of severe mental health and take regular medication for, which the staff were well aware off. They then told me I wouldn't get my medication untill Monday morning. After being told all day that i would be going home to being told no your not didn't go too well, i was fuming. I was adamant that i was going home. They did sort it out so i could go home, but caused me to miss a dose of my antibiotic, as they couldn't give me my first dose for Monday morning. I had to get my remaing medication from my GP.  While on that ward i didnt get a choice of food, it was what was left from other wards, which i found disgusting, that we weren't treated the same as any other patient. I felt like i was in an holding pen until they decided what to do with me. Then couldn't fulfill the requirements needed. To be told that your prescription isn't ready because they had a lot to do and yes my surname starts with a "W" so i could have been rihht down the list is unacceptable and unprofessional. Nurses were apologetic, but it doesn't give me much confidence in ever using Pinderfields inthe future.

author: Beebopalula
title: Bowel repair
body: I was given a CT scan which revealed a strangled small bowel. Mr. Emin met me & explained possible outcomes. It was a scary time but Mr. Emin & his team were very reassuring & I felt in safe hands. I was incredibly lucky to keep my bowel & I cannot praise Mr. Emin & his team enough for their excellent & professional care.....next to Jurgen Klopp, Mr. Emin is my favourite hero I owe him & the brilliant team everything. Thank you with all my heart & soul.

author: Carnoustie Patient
title: Out Patient Appointment
body:
I have been booked in for an Ear Syringing at Strathcathro. As I don't live nearby, I tried to find a contact phone number and/or the name of the department who would carry out this procedure, in order that I may find more guidance as to where to go, once I'd arrived at the hospital.  
However, despite extensive searching, no phone number nor listed department were on your website that I could contact. The only number to be found was for patients attending the Surgical Ward and I contacted them and was given the number I needed from the nurse who answered the phone.  
As the appointment was booked over the phone, I had no paperwork to check for a phone number, so would suggest you have a look at your website and make it more comprehensive to the patient.  
I am computer literate, but anyone who struggles with computers would find the whole website baffling

author: Jon1
title: Difficulty in contacting district nurses
body:
I have had difficulty contacting Runnymede district nurses to change/check my wife's hernia dressings. I have been ringing 03307260333, got no response for over 20 minutes, trying later, I was given yet another number 03003034737, left another message, and was told that my message would not be accessed until late afternoon  
Thus a woman discharged last Friday, has still not had the wounds/stitches examined, or dressings changed, and as yet, Thursday morning, no contact .  
One other point worth making, is that the web address suggested is quite long, it includes upper case, lower case, symbols, and when I used it, my message was returned as undeliverable. Bearing in mind that the age group trying to arrange a district nurse, is liable to be older than normal, why make the address so complicated??  
Regards, husband approaching melt down

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Grumpydad
title: My Alcohol Addiction and my road to recovery
body:
In November 2019 I admitted to my family that I had a bottle a day whiskey addition and I had become alcohol dependant. I had gone from being a functioning secret alcoholic to having to take a drink to work with me to enable me to function.  
I was given One Recovery's phone number and I was quickly offered an appointment. I was assigned Nicky and my life changed. From my initial assessment to being signed off I felt I could become sober under h√©r guidance.  
Despite a few lapses at the start, I have been over 6 months without a drink.  
With the help of One Recovery and especially Nicky, I have become the husband, Dad and Grandad I used to be. I still have my family due to your service.  
Thank You from myself and my family

title: Excellent
body: I attended a and e and was admitted for one night . My care was exceptional and despite being very busy all staff were so caring and professional

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely staff!
body: I‚Äôm so sorry- I‚Äôve totally forgotten the name of the nurse who did my implant procedure this morning, however she was so very lovely and polite and really easy to talk to, it made an anxiety-provoking situation so much more relaxing by being able to just freely chat about holidays, restaurants and whatnot. She was really polite, really down to earth and friendly and I just want to pass on my thanks for doing such a wonderful job (and for my party bag of condoms!)

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional service
body:
I attended the Brighton eye hospital A&E 24th August 2020 in the afternoon and my overall experience was of the highest standards of care ,nothing was to much trouble , the staff were very supportive from making my own personal telephone referral  in the morning , giving me a time to attend the appointment up to helping me fill out my admission form on arrival  which the reception staff took care of because of my visual problems, which has stopped me from being able to write my details .
The triage nurse ,the nurse who carried out my assessment and the Doctor in charge of my case we're excellent in all that they did and knew exactly the treatment I needed , eye scan, drops to dilate the eyes etc and the doctor conversing my diagnosis I was given all handled in a first class way , and I was treated with the respect that I was a human being not a statistic thankyou to the staff who handled my case 
Mr B Alexander

title: Awful, no patient care
body: Zero star review. Horrendous. Impossible to get through on the phone, had an appointment, was told I would be referred urgently, doctor never did the referral so now delayed care on something really urgent. Reception staff promise they'll get calls/appointments set up and it never happens. So upset it's beyond belief.

title: Good doctors, rude receptionist let the practice‚Ä¶
body:
I arranged a consultation over the phone and the doctor was extremely helpful referring me for an X-ray at MRI but to ring back in ten minutes and reception would give me the details and sort it.
I rang back and was rudely spoken too by the receptionist who eventually agreed to send me the details I needed to attend hospital with a referral on a message linked via my phone.

I made my way to the MRI and upon walking the vast corridors with a suspected fracture to my foot I was told they did not accept referrals unless they come directly from the practice and not via me which they said the practice should know.

I then had to walk all the way back out the hospital to get a signal to contact Florence Practice only to be shouted at by the same receptionist telling me it was emergencies only over the phone (whilst eating a sandwich) as if I should know how they operate.
I found myself stranded at the hospital for nearly an hour waiting for lunch to finish so the receptionist could rectify the mistakes that were initially made!
I contacted Florence Practice for a third time and was spoken to by another staff member who spoke to me nice and respectfully as expected and helped by sending the referral direct to radiology which should have been done in the first place!

Coming from a civil service background myself I find it appalling to be treated so badly by a rude and incompetent receptionist who dealt with me on the first two occasions.
May I stress, the doctor and the radiology dept were fantastic and dealt with me quickly and respectfully.

title: 100% Recommended
body:
I saw one of the GPs with a lump that I had found. He referred me straight to the hospital and I‚Äôd had my appointment within 2 weeks and a cancer diagnosis a week after. 

After an initial physical examination, the doctor at the hospital didn‚Äôt think it was anything to worry about, but scans unfortunately showed that not to be the case.

I am incredibly grateful that the GP from Ratby Surgery didn‚Äôt think twice about referring me. It could have been a very different story otherwise.

Thank you for doing what you do and making a difference.

title: Efficient and friendly
body: Had to attend to sort antibiotics for cat bite through calf muscle when weekend hours caused issues re out of hours.Phoned in advance and told to attend. Staff were lovely - had full review and left with meds within half hour of arrival. 111 initially referred me to an A&E but I‚Äôd left as 5 hour wait. Very impressed with this Unit - thorough, friendly, efficient

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent!
body:
Having been thwarted by the web form I called to make a telephone appointment. The receptionist was helpful and I got a call-back less than two hours later.

I'm glad I ignored the negative reviews, most of which, on examination, don't stand up - complaints about a lack of cheer are prevalent, and outdated (they've had a recent refurb) comments about the decor. This isn't a restaurant, or a boutique!

Anyway, my experience has been absolutely positive and I'd happily recommend it. My GP is great, too; not just the prompt call-back but the professionalism and care she has extended.

title: Amazing Staff
body: I was seen at The Royal Berks A&E Department on 19th of August. The staff were extremely friendly and reassuring. Although clearly busy they made me feel as relaxed as possible and that I was important. They are a credit to the NHS

title: Professional and welcoming .
body: Always get seen within a couple of days. The telephone service during Covid has been exemplary and reassuring for both my husband and myself . Staff are friendly as well as professional.it is easy to understand why you have to give information to be able to be seen by the correct person.

title: No treatment offered
body:
Awaiting the removal of my gall bladder I attended Surgical Outpatients.  However, despite being in continuous considerable pain and being listed as urgent I, like many others, still have no idea when we might receive treatment.  Living with severe pain has had a significant impact on my mental health.
Although, I can fully appreciate the pressure the NHS is under it now seems to be the strategy to ignore any patient who is not infected with the Covid virus.  Surely by not offering treatment to those suffering with conditions other than the Covid virus is not only very short sighted but condemns some patients to suffer unnecessarily but may even lead to death.  Please don't ignore us.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Totally confusing
body: Tried to book an appt for blood test and ecg at the doctor's request today. I was told by the receptionist I had to call the phlebotomy number as bloods were not available there any longer. I called the number it took me 35 mins to get through only to be told they had not received the form from the surgery yet. Called back Court street who said that diabetic bloods and emergency bloods were still done, when I questioned further I was put on hold. The receptionist then came back saying no it was the phlebotomy number I had to call again. When I asked about the ecg I was told I could get that done by a nurse practitioner at the surgery, but I had to almost demand an appointment despite the doctor telling me this morning to get it done sooner rather than later. I feel exhausted. So now I have to call phlebotomy again tomorrow and waste another 30 mins to be answered. Ridiculous. Not very good communication between staff.

title: Absolute Shambles
body: I just cannot believe how terrible this doctors surgery is. It is outrageous. I have spent the last 1 hour 30 minutes trying to call the surgery for an appointment. God forbid if this appointment was a matter of urgency. The staff should be sacked, they never answer the phones. It is poor and appalling. The only doctors I know of that‚Äôs unable to schedule you in for a future appointment. Outrageous!

title: Lack of communication
body: A close relative of mine has been in Heartlands 3 times in the last 6 months, the first 2 times all staff have been absolutely fantastic despite being exceptionally busy during the pandemic (AAU, AMU and Ward 28) and have kept the family fully informed when we have called for updates. However, my relative on the last admission (currently) was transferred from AAU to Ward 1. I called at 9.20am for an update on my relatives condition and was told nobody was available to speak to me and call back in 30 minutes, this situation continued for 5 hours either the nurse was discharging a patient or dealing with the drugs trolley. On 2 occasions as I was getting increasingly frustrated I was promised a call back which was never received. Only when I insisted on complaining to the ward manager did the nurse come to speak to me. This lack of communication is unacceptable, while I understand and accept this is still a busy and difficult time for the staff it is a worrying time for relatives too especially when their loved one is terminally ill.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Extremely Professional
body:
I had a CT Scan today in the portable scanning unit (outside Childrens Services) and was impressed with the experience.
The Radiographer took time to explain the procedure(s) and ensured that I was OK before I left.
Marks 15 out 10!!!!
Graham Davies

title: Very dissapointed
body: Extremely disappointed with rude and insensitive behavior in A&E. I had to rush my husband to A&E on 11th August night as his heart rate was rapidly increasing after a small surgery earlier in the day (at another hospital). When I went to A&E, one particular lady at the entrance was extremely rude and insenitive. I was told that only patients are allowed inside (due to COVID-19) which is absolutely fine and I completely appreciate it. However, after leaving my husband, he came out again near the entrance as he was experiencing symptoms so wanted to get his BP checked. I went towards him to check if he was okay but I was shocked at how rude the lady behaved with me and my husband, especially at a really vulnerable time for us (and particularly my husband). She said "you are not going to jump up the queue if you stand here and stare right at our faces". Again I appreciate the pressure that the staff are facing with the current crisis but that doesn't give you the right to behave so rudely and insensitively with people who are going through an extremely scary time in the A&E. The doctors inside were very helpful though.

title: Disappointed
body:
I only requested an answer to query concerning GPs wearing of face covering ?
I visited on 03/8/20 wearing mask and hands sanitised and was escorted through to surgery. I was surprised GP was not wearing a face covering. 
I telephoned surgery on two occasions, and each time was assured someone would call me back re query later the same day. 
To date I have not been afforded the courtesy of a return call. 
I have been with this practise for over 20 years, and have never had cause to complain in writing ?
It‚Äôs not a ‚Äòlife or death‚Äô situation, just a polite response would have been greatly appreciated. 
Regards
Diana Roche

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Bad practice
body:
I emailed the surgery asking for a referral letter for pain in my knee. Email response saying I had to call surgery. 10 minute wait to speak to Reception who made an appointment for a doctor to call me. No time given other than "late morning". My phone has been with me all day and I have just noticed that at 11:30 I missed the call and that I should contact Reception again to make another appointment. What's the point? Are they really concerned about their patients? I appreciate that they are under pressure (like those of us who are working during the pandemic) and that my knee pain is not currently life-threatening (until it fails while I am driving) but a little more effort to contact the patient would be useful.
Now I have the stress of trying to contact them again.
Really not happy at all

title: Son suffering tonsillitis
body: Telephoned in the morning as my son was so poorly with white spots and a severe sore throat and temperature,Dr.S.Morcos telephoned me by 2pm and a prescription at the chemist immediately fantastic surgery.

title: Unacceptable Service
body:
Requested an appointment with doctor due to ongoing issue.
Got a phone call from doctor, very abrupt. Need blood tests.
Had bloods a week later.
Received letter from NHS regard blood result - concerns.
Phone surgery (40mins) ask for blood results, told they cannot give it over the phone. Told to email the surgery so they can forward me the results.
After two emails and a week later they still have not responded.
Called again and questioned the blood results and when the doctor would get back to me.
I was told my bloods are OK, but cannot give it over the phone.
So letter from NHS state otherwise, so who do I believe?
Asked when the doctor would call me, told I have to book an appointment. Did so and could only get one in a weeks time.
Why can't I get my blood results? 
Why can't the doctor call back.
8 weeks I have had this issue.
Phoned another surgery and they answered within 4 minutes, asked to register there and was asked where my current surgery is. Told them and they responded by saying "we are not taking anyone on from Abbey Meads". 
Abbey Meads claim to be busy due to the coronavirus in their recorded message. But in the recorded message they tell you not to go to the surgery and give you contact detail if you have the virus. Funny contradiction.
I do not recommend this surgery.
I must add, all the staff are friendly, but this surgery is being managed badly.

title: Excellent service
body:
I would like to say a big thank you to all the medical and front office staff at Ratby Surgery. They are all so understanding and supportive with nothing being too much trouble for them. Their patience and professionalism is greatly appreciated.

All the administrative and support staff are friendly, cheery and helpful.

Thank you one and all!

title: Great practice
body: Friendly and efficient service from reception staff. Always polite and do their best to accommodate your appointment preferences. Doctors professional and always call you back in a timely manner.

title: waste NHS Money
body:
2 weeks ago 2 letters for new appointments. Today five letters all dated 20/08/20 1) to tell me all appointments converted to telephone.2) 2 letters telling me all appoints cancelled due to virus. 3) another with 2 new appoints on same day one changing time by 5 minutes. Telephone hospital to check on appoints ok but told I was not the only one geting 5 or six lettters dated the same date. How much waste on The NHS is going on Paper,ink & Postage
No wonder the NHS is short of money!!!!!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reception never answer the phone
body: Tried to make an appointment online but was unsuccessful. Tried on many accessions to phone to make an appointment but either line was busy line or the receptionist didn't answer. after 2 weeks and symptoms getting worse I emailed and was advised to book an appointment online. I phoned head office and explained my difficulties who advised they would get the surgery to phone me but this didn't happen. Great doctors at this surgery but getting an appointment via reception difficult. After 30 years plus I am considering looking for a new doctors surgery.

title: Outstanding Practice
body: Sadly my dear husband passed away on 23rd March but I now feel ready to say what wonderful, professional, compassionate staff at the Willow Green Surgery were during his illness.I cannot praise them highly enough.

title: Fantastic care and service
body:
Received excellent care from start to finish ...booking my surgery, fantastic care on the ward and the theatre and recovery staff were particularly amazing - thank
You!

Very impressed with the aftercare and know I‚Äôm in the very capable hands on the physio team to aid my recovery!

Thank you Team Alexandra

title: Fantastic service
body: When I called for a standard checkup I got an appointment for within a few days on the phone. I got called at 9:00 am prompt, and the service was excellent. The doctors said I would be rung by reception to book an ECG and writhing 2 minutes of getting off the phone I got a call to book the appointment. I got to the doctors for the ECG 20 minutes early and they saw me early! The nurse who did the ECG was really friendly and put me at ease, and everyone at the doctors was friendly and helpful. Really impressed by the service I have got for my standard checkup, and can‚Äôt speak highly enough of them

title: Great practice
body: From initial contact the level of service from reception staff and Dr was excellent  in difficult circumstances

title: First class treatment
body: I was rushed in by ambulance on Saturday the 15th Aug. around 8.30am  after having a heart attack. On arriving at the RD&E was a team waiting for me . I was immediately taken to theatre where I had four stents fitted and by 11.30 was back on the ward with a welcome cup of tea. I would just like to say a massive thankyou to all the consultants, doctors , nurses and everyone who helped me in my time of need.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Very compassionate Nurse
body: This GP is a really great GP, and this is reflected through the outstanding staff at Alexandra Surgery. The Nurse is extremely kind, caring and knowledgable, along with the doctors. I am grateful to attend this GP for the past 18 years as it is a highly professional GP.

title: Fantastic practice
body: I was referred to the hand clinic after visiting A&E minor injuries following an accident which left small pieces of metal in one of my fingers. The care I received was outstanding - I was examined, and after some discussion put onto the theatre list as the last patient of the day, even though they were full.  I would like to pass on my thanks to everyone involved in my care. I really can't praise the treatment I received highly enough.  My appointment was at 14.10, and less than four hours later I was on my way home, having had surgery with a local anaesthetic. How fortunate we are to have this clinic in Derby, that combines ultimate professionalism with wonderful care. Thank you .

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Two years wasted
body: I have been having treatment for over two years.In that time all I have had done is two extractions  one root canal and a incomplete poor fitting pallet.My teeth are no different from when I first started and today after another visit with toothache I was told I needed another tooth pulled.So after more than two years and numerous appointments I‚Äôm no better off in fact worse.Im now told my student has qualified and left and I‚Äôm now on the waiting list.If I‚Äôm honest a root canal and two extractions in over two years is a joke.I have attended numerous appointments but nothing ever seemed to get done.The pallet was an awful fit and I assume now after the lockdown and another tooth needing to be removed is no longer useable.So after years of attending I‚Äôm back to square one.I am 66 and at this rate I will never have anything to smile about.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: GP Contact during pandemic
body: The adjustments to managing patients with non urgent symptoms has been great as it allowed quicker contact with a GP over the phone for assessment and then follow up treatment in our case a practice nurse appointment. I hope these adjustments can be built into future GP service post Covid.

title: Fantastic staff - efficient and considerate
body:
I visited the surgical assessment unit at Northern General hospital. I have severe anxiety in regards to visiting hospitals and also have a vet bad phobia of needles which sets off panic attacks.
The staff went above and beyond to calm me down, were very understanding and took their time in completing these procedures.
I can not describe how much this had helped me in receiving my treatment and have never been so thankful to the NHS staff.
I would absolutely recommend this ward to anyone who suffers with extreme anxiety like myself and they even gave me tips to calm myself in the future.
If possible, please pass this to staff on the ward. You were absolute heroes!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Endoscopy department
body: Excellent care throughout the experience. All the staff were very caring and aware of the Patient concerns . Excellent. Thank you

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well looked after
body:
Stent removed today very smooth procedure humorous and efficient team ran to time home and comfortable
Wish you all well

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Smiling with eyes
title: Staff were really reassuring
body:
I took my Mum to the Ards Testing Centre to get a Covid swab prior to coming up to the Hospital for a Day Procedure. She was anxious but the member of staff who did the swab ‚ÄúGillian‚Äù was really reassuring and managed to smile with her eyes whilst wearing PPE! Having her name on her visor was also a nice touch which my Mum really appreciated.  
Thank you!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Michael101011
title: Made everything so comfortable
body:
Recently went in to get an ACL reconstruction, I was in for a day case so was pretty quick. The nurses and doctors made everything so comfortable which put me at ease, received food and drinks after which was needed.  
Thanks to everyone who helped me out.

author: Agnmr37
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Health Inclusion Team
body:
**The Health Inclusion Team is a specialist team of nurses working with families with children aged 0 to 19 and young adults who are living in temporary accommodation, gypsies and travellers, victims of domestic abuse, trafficking, asylum seekers or refugees.**  
**As a service HIT has historically struggled to gain service user and carer feedback. Due to the pandemic team had to replace the majority of their face to face contacts with telephone consultations. The narrative below is a summary of feedback that was individually collected. **  
Overall, the service provided during pandemic was excellent because I was seen at home and was really supported. The telephone appointments were very good and the instructions given over the phone were clear. I felt very okay about the team visiting me at home, it was very lovely. The changes made to the service during pandemic were perfect and they used PPE.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lady in waiting
title: Waiting time for gallbladder surgery
body:
In May 2019 I had the first of experience of gallbladder problems when an acute bout of pain ended up with me being admitted to Ninewells Hospital in Dundee.I was given antibiotics and pain medication and received various scans. I was informed then that I would probably need to get my gallbladder removed.  
But after about a week I was sent home. I had a number of recurrent bouts of this pain and was in and out of hospital 4 or 5 times over the next few months. Each time being told yes I needed my gall bladder removed. And was put on the waiting list for surgery.  
In each visit the staff and all who took care of me were wonderful.I could not have wished for better care and I do think that everyone in the NHS really do go that extra mile for patients. But I never once got a direct answer when I asked how long it would be until I got my surgery.  
Eventually I did get a letter of apology because I had not had the surgery within the NHS waiting times. Then I received a letter telling me to go to Perth Royal Infirmary for my surgery in March. I attended and waited. Only to be told by the consultant that I should not have been sent that letter as this was for routine operations only and mine might not be routine. Also he was going on holiday the next day, but would have me on his list for when he returned. but by the time he did get back this whole Covid thing had happened.  
I fully understand the disruption that Covid has caused. And my thoughts and prayers are with all who work in the NHS all through this time. I have phoned a couple of times to ask for information, but just get told that at this time there is nothing they can tell me as my surgery is not urgent.  
How do I feel about this? Having my life on hold popping pain pills when needed with morphine on standby just in case the pain does get bad enough, and feeling generally unwell for all this time is to say the least depressing. Not just for the effect it is having on me, but on family and friends as well. Basically I just want this over with.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: sawlady24
title: Haematology appointment
body:
I have a condition where I have to have my blood checked every 4 weeks since having blood poisoning around 4 yrs ago, the haematology dept sent me letters to state that I should not attend the hospital due to Covid-19, they said I would receive a phone call last Thursday. The phone call came an hour early and did not ring very long, by the time I had got my phone out from my handbag the call had ended. I phoned the number straight back and was told that no-one could take my call but they would pass a message on that I had called and someone would call me back by the end of the day, I did not receive a call back.  
I am feeling very anxious about my condition and the fact that my blood is not being checked. Missing the call and no one calling me back has increased this.  
I realise staff are very busy but I have since phoned at least 6 times and all I am told is that staff are aware I have called.  
I now have received a letter to say my next phone call appointment will not be until 17th December, this is over 4 mths to wait and I am very ill and in considerable pain.  
You ask what could be improved? I would suggest more staff to make these phone calls to patients, I feel I and other patients are being ignored and pushed aside due to covid-19.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: lynxrf46
title: True healers
body:
I have experienced the best and worst of Yeovil Hospital. The worst was in A & E, several times, when there were more patients than the staff could be expected to cope with. The best was in The Frailty Unit both in the past and recently, where my treatment couldn`t have been bettered were I a queen.  
I had a thorough health assessment. I saw experienced nurses, a doctor, a consultant, all to myself, in private and comfortable conditions. They all LISTENED TO ME. They HEARD WHAT I SAID. They reacted to what I told them in a cheerful and confident manner. I didn`t feel rushed.  
I still have health problems but since that visit my mood has risen, even though I have suffered clinical depression for most of my life. The lesson is that the atmosphere in that clinic did as much - even more - to heal my mind, as any physical intervention might do to heal my body. The staff in that room, each individual, were true healers.

author: Owl23
title: Upsetting medical history included in referral letter
body:
I requested a letter from Nethergreen Surgery referring me to a private hospital for a consultation about varicose vein surgery. I received the letter but it included historical medical history that I did not request and did not find relevant.  
The medical history included a historical traumatic event that I had never seen in writing before and, as I was not expecting to see it, it caused me some distress that I feel could have been avoided if it had not been sent to me or if, at the least, I had been warned that I would be receiving this information.  
I also opened the letter in the presence of family members who do not know my medical history which added to my distress.

author: Owl23
title: Praise for Nurse at GP Practice
body:
Attended Nether Green Surgery for routine Cervical Screening.  
Sally the nurse was really friendly and made time to do additional tests that I hadn't booked in for. She was non-judgmental and it was much appreciated. She is a credit to the surgery.

title: long waiting times on phone, poor prescription‚Ä¶
body:
When this became S/wood med p/ship, it went from a nice village surgery without waiting times, to what we have now - without any apparent reason and not one area of improvement in service then or since.
I was asked to contact the surgery earlier this week; i rang two times, 'waiting' each time for around 15 mins, before the call was cut off. Today, Friday, i waited for 35 minutes before someone answered and, within 30 secs, put me on hold. Ten minutes later, the call was cut off again!!
I am now waiting, again, time waiting this time is 19'.36" and i am now #1 in the call queue - Hooray!!... the doctors are great by the way, and i don't necessarily think it's the fault of the staff -perhaps there just aren't have enough of them. But it cannot excuse what Farnsfield would i'm see as poor performance since they took over the surgery.
